Empath::

The most direct route has usually worked best for Empath.  She tu=
rns 
toward Windlord and gently places her hands on either side of his 
hea=
d.  "It's easier to show you than tell you," she says.  "Try to 
relax - I =
won't hurt you."

She reaches out with her mind, drawing Windlord's feeling=
s for her to 
the surface.  Empath's gratified to learn that her initial as=
sessment 
was correct, but she's not done.  Briefly, she opens her own mind=
 to 
the Maximal, allowing him to see all she's seen - from her creation 
m=
illions of years ago, through the Great War, to the pain of losing 
Skywarp=
 to Galvatron's selfish machinations.  She shows him the 
reformatting, whe=
n she became a predacon trapped under Galvatron's 
control; finding the Sou=
l Orb and accidentally freeing herself; and 
finally, she shows the recent =
events that have drawn them to this 
moment - and the fact that her own emo=
tions mirror his.
